title: Email for the people.
text: Anyone can get an email address within minutes, and it works seamlessly with the desktop version. With 15 gb free storage, you can keep just about all your email in one place. The downside is that Google adsense hits shows up as a top- or side-bar to your emails like Google searches. I‚Äôm a longtime user and have found, for myself at least, that the desktop version works best for searching through years of email.

title: Constant updating; still buggy
text: Anytime I try to attach a photo, I get error messages.  If I leave the app in the midst of writing an email, I get an error message when I return.  Too many times to count in the past few months, a significant portion of an email disappears when I hit send - but I don‚Äôt realize it unless I check my ‚Äúsent‚Äù folder.  So now I go through the hassle of copying and pasting any long email into the Keep app, before I hit send.  And equally frustrating is that messages I thought I had sent, get stored as drafts instead.  I have to constantly monitor the true performance of Gmail, by using my iPhone, which reveals the errors.  I‚Äôm very close to finding a new email app.  I‚Äôve used Gmail almost since inception, but the iPad Gmail app has become almost useless.  And it‚Äôs fairly recent so I suspect it has something to do with incompatibility with iOS updates.  But it seems okay on my iPhone - however I don‚Äôt compose long messages on my iPhone, so who knows.  It‚Äôs unacceptable.
